Thanks for your help

NOT IMPRESSED THAT MY COMMENT WAS DELETED. I DO EXPECT A REPLY AND A COURSE OF ACTION.

So I was just at the Plaza Singapure outlet last night, and wanted to get the a christmas mug which comes with the stirrer. 

I found it and went to the cashier to pay, while making payment, I asked "doesn't this come with a stirrer?" because I had noticed that the stirrer wasn't in the mug. And the trainee at the cashier said "oh yes" and proceeded to ask his colleague to search for it while I made payment.

And this is where it all goes downhill.

Now this colleague, then says to the cashier "this doesn't come with a stirrer" and the cashier said that he's pretty sure that it does. So the colleague went to check the catalog. He then proceeds to the merchandise area to look for it. While doing this, I see that he gets a text, and he then comes to me to say "My partner threw all the stirrers away".

Are.you.kidding. me. So all the mugs on display have no stirrers. I don't know what he expected me to say. I told him "I just paid full price for this, I expect to get a full set." He then says that he will do a refund. No apology.

He goes to the cashier guy, admonishes him on making a transaction (the cashier is a trainee btw). The cashier apologised several times to me, but I found it amazing that the "colleague" did not bother. 

I saw that the colleague had put the mug back on the shelf. Now, I don't think this is ethical or right to do so. He knows FULL WELL that the mug doesn't come in a full set, and yet chooses to display it for sale at full price? 

I made a comment about it to them, and the colleague ignored me. So I repeated, the cashier then asked the colleague if he should take it off the shelf and the colleague said "No." and only the store manager has authority to.

I asked for the store manager, the colleague first ignored me, then simply said that he wasn't in when I repeated myself. So I asked when does he come in to the outlet, he says that he doesn't know. That, I know to be a blatant lie. I find it hard to believe that an employee has no idea on the store schedule. So I pressed for an answer, and he went to check. He said that the store manager, Aaron, will be in this coming Thursday, in the morning.

I also can't believe that the person who threw away the stirrers knew full well that they were a part of the mug set, but yet told no one to rectify it. So it was still being sold in the shop.

I plan to make my way there then, to make sure that the store manager knows about this.

Mainly because, I the service given by of the "colleague" was very poor and the blaise attitude of selling an item at full-price, when it's not a full set. He made no attempt at saying that it will be noted for all the staff of the other shifts either. He was not pleased that I asked for the store manager. 

If I had not asked for the stirrer, I would've just been sold the mug. The idea that staff there aren't sure on the merchandise being sold is concerning, and worse that they don't care that they're effectively cheating on their customers.

Is this Starbucks way of operation? Knowingly selling items which aren't a full set, at full price?
Does the purse come with the stick-on patches ??? Wanted get some for my Christmas Party for my BFFs.

16.post_text: For a sip of holiday magic all year round.

comments.message: I visited the outlet at Eastpoint mall today around 3.30pm. I was served by a lady called Suri. I ordered 4 drinks, 2 tumblers and topped up my Starbucks card at the same time. There wasn’t a long queue at that time and I believe my transactions were not very complicated. I was not greeted, treated with hostility as if my requests were extraordinary, and my transaction was erred (found out after the incident). I didn’t receive any receipt and didn’t bother asking for it but proceeded to wait for my drinks. After waiting for 5 mins, the barista at the other end asked what were we waiting for? We told him our orders and he requested for my receipt. I didn’t have it and thus he asked Suri. She passed him the receipts and he was also confused as there were no drink orders made. When asked, she said “it’s all there just take a look” as if it was the barista’s or my fault. After the barista checked again, they concluded i haven’t even paid for any drinks and should go over to pay first. I had to wait for another 5 mins again for her to key in 4 drinks, and paid for it. All while Suri did not apologise or even showed any sign of apology/remorse for having to put me through this situation. Her attitude really offended me. Is this how Starbucks want to represent itself, with your front line staff treating their customers with such poor attitude? It wasn’t even a busy period, my orders are not complicated. I’m not upset at the mistake Suri made in keying in my drink orders wrongly. I’m very offended by her attitude from the start to the end of the service. Even when I made it clear that I was going to write a feedback on this, she still showed attitude like it doesn’t matter.
Pls bring in design from korea starbucks... It's so pretty!!!!! 😍😍😍 Starbucks Singapore Starbucks Korea
I would like to thank all the staffs @ Keat Hong CC.. Great service guys!! Keep it up.. 😊👍🏻

Limited to one redemption per person, while stocks last.

22.post_text: For a sip of holiday magic all year round.

comments.message: I visited the outlet at Eastpoint mall today around 3.30pm. I was served by a lady called Suri. I ordered 4 drinks, 2 tumblers and topped up my Starbucks card at the same time. There wasn’t a long queue at that time and I believe my transactions were not very complicated. I was not greeted, treated with hostility as if my requests were extraordinary, and my transaction was erred (found out after the incident). I didn’t receive any receipt and didn’t bother asking for it but proceeded to wait for my drinks. After waiting for 5 mins, the barista at the other end asked what were we waiting for? We told him our orders and he requested for my receipt. I didn’t have it and thus he asked Suri. She passed him the receipts and he was also confused as there were no drink orders made. When asked, she said “it’s all there just take a look” as if it was the barista’s or my fault. After the barista checked again, they concluded i haven’t even paid for any drinks and should go over to pay first. I had to wait for another 5 mins again for her to key in 4 drinks, and paid for it. All while Suri did not apologise or even showed any sign of apology/remorse for having to put me through this situation. Her attitude really offended me. Is this how Starbucks want to represent itself, with your front line staff treating their customers with such poor attitude? It wasn’t even a busy period, my orders are not complicated. I’m not upset at the mistake Suri made in keying in my drink orders wrongly. I’m very offended by her attitude from the start to the end of the service. Even when I made it clear that I was going to write a feedback on this, she still showed attitude like it doesn’t matter.
Pls bring in design from korea starbucks... It's so pretty!!!!! 😍😍😍 Starbucks Singapore Starbucks Korea
I would like to thank all the staffs @ Keat Hong CC.. Great service guys!! Keep it up.. 😊👍🏻
